page.title: 14LAW AND ORDER
page.content: There were 67 crimes reported,this year,all of which were minor offences. 10 out of 12 cases of theft,the police solved.11 burglaries took place and 5 have been solved.8 cases of criminal damage occurred,3 were major damage and 5 were minor offences,where less than Â£20 worth of damage was caused. This year there have been no major crimes in Silver End, but there was 1 case of murder in Coggeshall,6-7 miles away.3 domestic arguments were noted, but fortunately no assaults occurred. P.C.Miller attended 8 road accidents but there were no serious injuries.In the case of theft,no cars were stolen but four bikes were taken.There is the occasional act of foolish vandalism, usually directed at public property, but Silver End is a law-abiding,safe and happy village.
